page.title: 01A GENERAL VIEW OF BUNNY
page.content: The name{Bunny}comes from the Saxon word Bune,which means village in the reeds.Bunny is in a shallow valley and in the distance you can see{Bunny Hill covered in woodland.{Fairham Brook runs through the fields which are used for crops and cattle grazing.There are 7 farms in Bunny.The{A60 Loughborough {Road}runs through Bunny. There is a brickworks called{H.J.Baldwin.}The houses in Bunny are built with brick and tile. There are houses of all ages and the oldest buildings are{Bunny {Hall,}the{almshouses}and the{church. {St.Mary's}church it is the biggest in South Nottinghamshire.In Bunny the only shop is the{Post Office}and it sells almost anything.The only school is{Bunny C.E. Primary School}which has 60 children from Bunny and Bradmore. The only pub in the village is{The {Rancliffe Arms,}once a coaching inn.
